html:
2.24.21  11:53 am   what music do you like listening to?

      regular

2.24.21  11:40 am   do you find it beneficial to your mental health to write songs when you say that you've only 'almost' written a song that you like?

      i've never said that. i've written hundreds of songs that i like better than any song i've ever heard. which is good for my mental health for a small moment, until my brain explodes from too much excitement

2.24.21  11:28 am   what is the worst thing you have done

      divided by 0

2.24.21  10:24 am   i like egg do u like egg

      it's ok

2.24.21  9:30 am   what's the weirdest musical instrument you've ever played? what's the weirdest one you've used in a song? 

      street sign

2.24.21  9:17 am   want to write. cant start. dont know shit about music theory. how?

      how does music make you feel? that will be your first music theory

2.24.21  8:43 am   hi. you've stated that you record your videos in 30 fps.

     i've never said that, nor done it

      Why not use 24 fps?

     scrolling to the side can sometimes have a frightful picket fence effect. that would potentially be one of the downsides to using 24fps. And also at 25fps, which was the frame rate of all my videos up until 2020

      it'll feel/look less home videoish and more cinematic since 24 fps is the film industry standard. 30fps can look a bit comical even if you're trying to convey seriousness. Most major films and music videos all are shot in 24 fps.

      that is a good idea, but, i was going to first encourage you to change some of the doors in your house to a different type of door. hear me out: why not use the kind of doors used in the Film industry?

2.24.21  7:24 am   Do you know why singing is so good for ourselves ? 

      it's a good way to compare data among thousands of different feelings, while also telling thousands of tiny stories, all in the time span of a few seconds

2.24.21  7:04 am   hey bill why is arkansas pronounced like that 

      the reason it is pronounced like that is due to algonquin. the reason it is spelled like that is due to french

2.24.21  5:35 am   thoughts on memes?

      they're pretty good

2.24.21  3:19 am   How do I come up with something that's never been done before? I don't feel creative enough to do it.

      there are 2 ways to do this. you could either learn everthing that's ever been done, and then do something different. or, don't learn anything anyone's ever done, and then hope that your thing is not the same as theirs by coincidence

2.24.21  2:49 am   what do you think of music without lyrics?

      where did you find it

2.24.21  2:37 am   are you happy with here comes the sun?

      somewhat

2.24.21  1:11 am   Which of your songs would be best played as a piano solo?

      'hey mom, i beat the scale'

2.24.21  12:51 am   I love listening to all kinds of music. This includes Jazz and electronica. But when I make music I always gravitate to just using the root, fifth and octave or simple pentatonic scales and not much more. I'm so stuck on these basic notes. And it does sound good to me but how can I feel less like a fraud?

      it sounds like it's time for you to spend some more quality time with your instrument(s)

2.23.21  11:59 pm   When you write songs, do you have any hidden meanings behind the lyrics in mind?

     meanings of all kinds, flood through my mind as i'm writing songs. songs are often my best chance at expressing some of those meanings

      Or are they more on word play and how they sound with the music?

      all those things you just mentioned are meaningful, AND can express meaning

2.23.21  11:11 pm   Throughout human history, music has been used as a workman's tool. Pastoralists in the Congo incorporated  whistles and shouts as methods to show where they were. There were also the sea shanties of pirates and armadas, the Skaldic verses of the Vikings, and the hunting horns used by French Royalty. What are your thoughts about how these working songs have shaped human society,

     it's pretty good

      and how do you think they will continue to affect the course of human society?

     for now, .............. online

2.23.21  10:53 pm   making music. it is not good. how do I make it good 

      try adding just a touch of non-music to it

2.23.21  10:32 pm   When do you think of the title for your songs?  Is it usually before, during, or after the song-writing process?  (Or is it like the last thing you think of before posting the video?)

      sometimes before, sometimes during, and sometimes after. sometimes all 3, if i keep changing it

2.23.21  9:41 pm   do you think the video you're working on now would take a shorter amount of time and/or would be easier to make if you hadn't already started working on it before re-inventing the graphics department? do you think your subsequent music videos will be faster/easier to make?

      all videos should take a reasonable amount of time

2.23.21  9:39 pm   what is your favorite songs that you made so far

      i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite

2.23.21  8:59 pm   were you originally going to be a song writer?

      yes

2.23.21  8:29 pm   why is there no music video for "got to know what's going on" unlike the other music videos?

      because i made the video "hi, i'm steve" instead. So that would have a ripple effect, so every other video i've done since then has come out probably about 5 weeks earlier than it would have, if i had done a music video for that song

2.23.21  8:17 pm   are you a real human ?

      oh man that would explain how ridiculous i feel right now

2.23.21  8:11 pm   when trying to write a piece, is it normal to just randomly get distracted and go into a jazz lick?

      sure

2.23.21  8:08 pm   your reality vids are so motivating and inspiring, and i've never seen anything else like it: seeing someone wrestle their creative process out of nothing, in real time, as they deal with obstacles.  do you have any "work inspiration" stories that give you a similar feel?

      the '6 days to air' documentary

2.23.21  8:00 pm   What is meaning of you rhyming "wistfulness, listlessness, wishfulness" in your next song?

      those words are not actually in the song, but that's probably just mother nature in action

2.23.21  7:58 pm   When did you get the passion to make music

      at every moment

2.23.21  7:40 pm   I struggle heavily with phone/social media addiction which I have only recently accepted is a problem. The time I spend on my phone doesn't provide much value to my life and keeps me from working on things that I believe could. Do you have any advice to kick this dumb habit?

      try actually turning the phone off. this is useful because many phones do not actually turn on very easily or quickly

2.23.21  7:39 pm   What inspired you to make songs

      songs

2.23.21  7:04 pm   did u predict the future when you put a photo of "joe biden" next to "go back to where you come from" in crazy / raining rough draft ?

      no. he was the vice president of the united states, at the time. That picture is a picture of him, being the vice president. that picture was also a popular meme at the time

2.23.21  6:30 pm   do black lives matter

      yes as a matter of fact they do

2.23.21  6:10 pm   Tips on building up creativity. 

      live your 'life'

2.23.21  5:40 pm   What inspired "the road"? It's surreal but it still feels like it's grounded in something.

      during 2009 and 2010 especially, i was doing this thing where i would write songs on paper only, with no instrument. Just start at the beginning and see where it goes. i wrote a lot of songs that way. i guess you could call it 'chain writing', or 'train writing', because the whole thing is written in order. And it's all done on the chart, on paper. Then around 2011 i got envious of more 'normal' songs, so i finally learned how to be organized enough to work on songs at an instrument, find a chorus first maybe, learn how to write what's before the chorus, you know, normal stuff. So i did a lot of that during 2011. Near the beginning of 2012, however, there was a day where i fondly remembered the joy of 'chain writing' so i did some of those. and 'the road' is one of them. So it is likely that the contents of the song somehow reflects the context of that situation

2.23.21  5:35 pm   i'm having an existential crisis. how did you discover that music was the right path for you?

      it was irresistible

2.23.21  5:17 pm   what made you come up with history of the entire world, i guess

      first i had to try very hard to figure out what the history of the entire world actually was

2.23.21  4:44 pm   Your music is like a map for wayward souls, thanks! Please tell me it's not actually a map to New Canaan though, I know how to get there perfectly fine. Their building department has FABULOUS bathrooms

      that would just a sample map. your individual maps may vary

2.23.21  4:04 pm   does the line in "here comes the sun" about the postman going to the top of the mountain and saying there's no news have anything to do with steve getting mail at the top of his mountain in "hi i'm steve"

      might be the same writer

2.23.21  2:27 pm   will you write a book?

      i think i prefer to write outside of books

2.23.21  2:17 pm   how would you describe your humor

      never heard of it

2.23.21  1:14 pm   I can only work on one project for 2 weeks before I get tired and I can't work anymore. This is mostly fine, because I can just do things that take 2 weeks, but sometimes I want to make longer things that take more time. How do you stay motivated in month-long and year-long projects, like your history videos?

      someone's gotta do it

2.23.21  12:55 pm   Any tips for being more likeable and less weird?

      start by writing down what you like

2.23.21  11:29 am   have you ever made a song you liked

      almost

2.23.21  10:40 am   Did you write "is slef" on your YouTube about page on purpose or was is supposed to be like that?

      both

2.23.21  10:11 am   what do you feel about musicians who have no drive to create their own music but play other people's music instead

      might add them to my contacts list

2.23.21  9:34 am   i am new to music and i want to make my first song any tips?

      try to make something that's not a song. that may be one of the easiest ways to get something to become a song

2.23.21  9:30 am   i am scared why am i scared

     because there are too many wonderful possibilities

     i don't want to be scared

      sing a song

2.23.21  9:22 am   is your next video gonna be a music video for a song?

      yes

2.23.21  9:21 am   Is your next project ambitious?

      it's not supposed to be

2.23.21  9:20 am   I can't get the idea out of my head that everything worth saying has already been said. have you ever dealt with this problem?

     almost

     how? 

     the clue i found, to tell me this isn't true, was from the kurt cobain journals. which would be written somewhere around 1989 or maybe earlier. And he was saying essentially the same thing. "everything has already been done". And yet here i was, reading this at least 15 years later, knowing that many many new things had been done since he said that. So that was a pretty obvious giveaway that it wasn't true
